thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Tuesday, 27 Feb 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: U.S. seeks to ease concerns about retirement of top diplomat on North Korea policy

author: Reuters Editorial
title: U.S. seeks to ease concerns about retirement of top diplomat on North Korea policy
text:
WASHINGTON, Feb 27 (Reuters) - The U.S. State Department sought to ease concerns on Tuesday about the departure of its senior diplomat on North Korea policy, saying it had a “deep bench” of people who would be able to step in after the retirement Ambassador Joseph Yun.
“The State Department has 75,000 people that work for us around the world. To imply that Ambassador Yun is the only one that is capable of handling North Korea would simply be wrong,” State Department spokeswoman Heather Nauert told a briefing.
“We have a deep bench of very experienced people,” she added, citing acting Assistant Secretary Susan Thornton, the top official for East Asia affairs, and several other diplomats.
Reporting by David Alexander; Editing by Doina Chiacu
